name: Decimal expansion of 195^(1/7).
comment: In 1999 Cook showed that an odd perfect number with k distinct prime factors has c^c^k as an upper bound, where c denotes this constant.
reference: R. J. Cook, Bounds for odd perfect numbers. In Number Theory (edited by R. Gupta). CRM Proc. Lecture Notes #19, 67-71. Amer. Math. Soc., Providence, RI, 1999.
Paulo Ribenboim, The Little Book of Bigger Primes, Springer-Verlag NY 2004. See p. 84.
link: Index entries for sequences related to the decimal expansion of roots.
author: _Stefano Spezia_, Apr 03 2025
